availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Gorin (Barren County, Kentucky, merchant and banker)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, banker. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Gorin. Father of Mary E. Gorin, James E. Gorin, Laura Gorin, Emma Gorin, Ellen Gorin and Florence Gorin. Merchant in Glasgow, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed James Bryan in Glasgow in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Glasgow in 1850. Banker in Glasgow in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved individuals in Barren County in 1860. Clerical member of the Joint Board of Conference Stewards at the Louisville Annual Conference of the Methodist Episcopal Church, South, convening in Barren County in September 1863.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, p. 73A.

"Louisville Conference of the M.E. Church, South," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), October 7, 1863, p. 1.
